testing this gay shit

EDIT: Looks like >>dc58bef2-f43f-41e3-ab1a-b5f2cfd0d681 solved my spiritual woes as well. Even trying OP's "solution" wouldn't work, it just didn't let me fucking post. Now hopefully I can get back to using this as an imageboard.

posts.subject: Death Stranding No Longer PS4 Exclusive
posts.body:
**Let's get back to being /v/. If you haven't already, download https://anonfile.com/Kc07Bf2bnf/update_08chan_s_Millchan_version_201908081621_zip to fix your "processing post" problems. Worked like a charm for me**

>The official PS4 exclusives page on the Australian PlayStation site has seen a curious update. Spotted by ResetEra, Kojima’s Death Stranding appears to have been removed from the list.

>According to Wayback Machine, the list included Death Stranding as recently as May 31. This sudden change may be strange, but it’s not entirely surprising. 

>The game’s recently revealed official cover art does not feature the ‘Only on PlayStation’ branding standard in all PS4 exclusives. In fact, since the moment Kojima Productions announced its partnership with Sony, Death Stranding has always been referred to as a “console exclusive”, which essentially means PC is fair game.

>Despite this, the game was never formally announced for PC, but everyone assumed it’ll end up on PC… at some point. Landing on Sony’s PS4 exclusives page may have been an error to begin with, but the timing of this discovery could indicate that we’re getting close to an official reveal of the PC version.

>Indeed, Hideo Kojima will be among Geoff Keighley’s guests for gamescom: Opening Night Live in less than one week. Could this be the day?

>It seems unlikely confirmation of the PC version will come so close to launch, as console exclusive deals tend to hold off PC releases for some time. Whatever the case may be, though, plenty of PC players are likely already considering cancelling that PS4 version pre-order.

https://archive.fo/MHzN3

>>fca9dbc1-c536-4311-8225-4cb785171ff4
Just made the change. Silly that it isn't enabled by default. Hope nobody makes the mistake of using one of their regular names.

>>fb845556-fb98-4f44-83de-48b46bb44ca7
First I've personally heard of it

Damnit, this board is too slow. Hopefully it's not just me but the catalog hasn't seen much movement whatsoever since yesterday night. 
Must be a combination of the already significant losses after 8chan went down, plus the posting problems experienced here earlier, plus the general slowness is just making people more disinterested. 

There's no way I'm giving this up. No telling if 8chan will come back even after Jim finishes his business with the courts.

>>160282b4-9c75-46fb-b631-613881b0b015
What the fuck, Mark has a bunker now? He couldn't bear to not be the board owner of /v/? Utterly pathetic. I was enjoying my time not being under the tyrannical boot of he or his cronies, for whom death would be a mercy.

>>fb3a3090-535b-492d-88fc-916296dbce71
The webm loads for me, just very slowly. I use TOR.

>>a9bd5de7-61c1-4a6f-a19e-e32cbcd2e725
That's pretty damn good, but for your own sake, stay as far away from the Cake Kike as you can. You don't want his terrible influence corrupting you. People seem to forget that Mark was only tolerated because he owned a legacy board, nothing else. Without that authority, he is meaningless.

posts.subject: Vermintide 2 - The Winds of Magic
posts.body:
In case you haven't been staying abreast of the news, this expansion came out for Vermintide 2. Because it's my guilty pleasure, I ended up buying it (but only after the data mining shenanigans were resolved).

Has anybody here gotten a chance to play it yet? It's quite intense but I do have some gripes. With their latest "2.0" update, they truly did change a lot and not all for the better, mind you. Some weapons were nerfed, others buffed, enemies can sometimes feel more tanky (though in my opinion they're weaker where it counts, unless the rapier is just that strong)

Overall, lots of indecisiveness, but you must admit that they added quite a bit these past few days, DLC or no. All Fatshark really needs to do in order to gain my trust is just release all of the past DLC maps (for Vermintide 1) for free. Those ones at least had loads of content in them. The first 2 Vermintide 2 DLC were so fucking skimp it isn't even funny.
